subsc: Central government administration,Agricultural extension and research,Irrigation and drainage

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project has
            been assessed as satisfactory, with sustainability as
            likely. The World Bank Group's overall performance in
            project preparation, appraisal, and supervision is rated
            satisfactory. The Borrower's performance in project
            preparation, implementation, management, and performance
            monitoring was more than satisfactory. These are the key
            lessons learned and applicable to future similar projects in
            China: Compared to large-scale new irrigation areas,
            investment to improve and expand existing irrigation
            facilities in smaller areas which are simple in design and
            compact for rapid implementation costs less; and project
            benefits could be accrued county by county in a relatively
            short period. Government commitments in providing timely and
            adequate resources, effective leadership at all project
            levels, and the active participation of beneficiaries and
            stakeholders ensures smooth implementation, success, and
            sustainability. Keeping the project sub-components to a
            minimum reduces the complexity of preparation and
            implementation, thereby maximizing the use of resources.
            Pre-setting ceilings for investment and average unit prices
            constrains project planning and design, resulting in a low
            work quality and difficult operation and maintenance.
            Participating counties should be selected based on their
            financial capacity and willingness to contribute funds,
            recover costs from project beneficiaries, and repay debts.
            This ensures smooth project implementation.
